snippet: The Shanghai composite index gained 1.7 percent on Thursday and the Shenzhen index rose 3.1 percent.
abstract: Stocks in China rally, helped by the country's newly announced decision to open its markets to more foreign investment and expectations it might take steps to bolster flagging economic growth.
lead_paragraph: The Shanghai composite index gained 1.7 percent on Thursday and the Shenzhen index rose 3.1 percent.

headline.seo: Indexes Rise as China Moves to Ease Foreign Investment
headline.main: Indexes Up as China Acts to Lure Foreign Investors
headline.print_headline: Indexes Up as China Acts To Lure Foreign Investors
